name: 10 Questions about Al Pacino Movies | Movies

questions.text: Pacino starred in "And Justice For All" as an attorney who was out to get a judge. Who played the judge?
questions.explanation:
John Forsythe.

	Interesting, but one of his lesser known movies.

questions.text: "Dog Day Afternoon" starred Pacino in the true story of a bank robbery gone bad. Where did the attempted robbery take place?
questions.explanation:
New York City.

	Brooklyn, to be specific.

questions.text: What was Pacino's handicap in "Scent of a Woman"?
questions.explanation:
Blindness.

	Great job as an embittered veteran.

questions.text: Pacino was one of many stars in "Glengarry Glen Ross". Who wrote the play?
questions.explanation:
David Mamet.

	Prize-winner for Mamet. All-star cast.

questions.text: Pacino starred in the not-well-received "Scarface". Who was the director?
questions.explanation:
Brian de Palma.

	No too many critics were kind to this one.

questions.text: Who co-starred with Pacino in "Carlito's Way"?
questions.explanation:
Sean Penn.

	Good movie. Aiello was in "City Hall". Tambor was in "And Justice For All". Baldwin was in "Glengarry Glen Ross".

questions.text: Pacino played the title role in "Bobby Deerfield". In what activity  did he engage?
questions.explanation:
Race Car Driver.

	Early in his career.

questions.text: Which movie did NOT star Pacino?
What was Pacino's role in "City Hall"?
questions.explanation:
Mayor.

	Mayor of New York City. I could never get all the way through this one.
